page.title: 11POPULATION
page.content: IN NUN MONKTON THERE IS LITTLE CHANGE IN NUMBER SINCE THE 1891 CENSUS THOUGH CHANGE IN TYPE AND AGE GROUPS. THEN ABOUT 230 PERSONS WERE COUNTED WHICH INCLUDED FARM WORKERS. AT PRESENT 50 PEOPLE WORK LOCALLY INCLUDING SOME STAFF OF A WINE BUSINESS FROM ELSE WHERE, 60 LEAVE THE VILLAGE TO WORK MAINLY IN PROFESSIONS AND BUSINESS, 20 CHILDREN ATTEND PRIMARY SCHOOL, 15 SECONDARY SCHOOL AND 36 PEOPLE ARE RETIRED. THERE ARE NO ETHNIC MINORITY FAMILIES. FIVE FAMILIES ARE INDIGENOUS. ALL SPEAK STANDARD ENGLISH WITH SLIGHT LOCAL ACCENT BUT NO MARKED DIALECT. THERE IS LITTLE NEED FOR A POLICE PRESENCE EXCEPT WHEN OUTSIDE ELEMENTS ENTER. THE POST OFFICE HAS BEEN THE TARGET AND ON 24.8.85. AT A RACING EVENT A FATAL ACCIDENT TO A YOUTH CREATED AN INCIDENT REQUIRING POLICE REINFORCEMENT.
